verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. How long, O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>? wilt thou forget <S%H7911><s%> me for ever <S%H5331><s%>? How long wilt thou hide <S%H5641><s%> thy face from me <S%H6440><s%>?

How long shall I take <S%H7896><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%> in my soul <S%H5315><s%>, Having sorrow <S%H3015><s%> in my heart <S%H3824><s%> all the day <S%H3119><s%>? How long shall mine enemy <S%H341><s%> be exalted over me <S%H7311><s%>?

Consider <S%H5027><s%> and answer <S%H6030><s%> me <S%H3068><s%>, O Jehovah my God <S%H430><s%>: Lighten <S%H215><s%> mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>, lest I sleep <S%H3462><s%> the sleep of death <S%H4194><s%>;
Lest mine enemy <S%H341><s%> say <S%H559><s%>, I have prevailed <S%H3201><s%> against him <S%H6862><s%>; Lest mine adversaries rejoice <S%H1523><s%> when I am moved <S%H4131><s%>.
But I have trusted <S%H982><s%> in thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>; My heart <S%H3820><s%> shall rejoice <S%H1523><s%> in thy salvation <S%H3444><s%>.
I will sing <S%H7891><s%> unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, Because he hath dealt bountifully with me <S%H1580><s%>.
